title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
For the 4 kg mass:

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled vertical vectors, one up and one down, and no horizontal vectors

For the 8 kg mass:

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled vertical vectors, one up and one down

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled horizontal vectors, one left and one right

Note: Labels could be in words, symbols, or correct numerical values. The two masses were considered independently. It was not necessary to indicate that the tension forces had the same magnitudes or that the weights were different.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled vertical vectors, one up and one down, and no horizontal vectors

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled horizontal vectors, one left and one right

Note: Labels could be in words, symbols, or correct numerical values. The two masses were considered independently. It was not necessary to indicate that the tension forces had the same magnitudes or that the weights were different.

Note: Labels could be in words, symbols, or correct numerical values. The two masses were considered independently. It was not necessary to indicate that the tension forces had the same magnitudes or that the weights were different.

The student response earns two of the following points:

For the 4 kg mass:

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled vertical vectors, one up and one down, and no horizontal vectors

For the 8 kg mass:

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled vertical vectors, one up and one down

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled horizontal vectors, one left and one right

Note: Labels could be in words, symbols, or correct numerical values. The two masses were considered independently. It was not necessary to indicate that the tension forces had the same magnitudes or that the weights were different.

The student response earns all of the following points:

For the 4 kg mass:

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled vertical vectors, one up and one down, and no horizontal vectors

For the 8 kg mass:

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled vertical vectors, one up and one down

1 point is earned: For two correctly labeled horizontal vectors, one left and one right

Note: Labels could be in words, symbols, or correct numerical values. The two masses were considered independently. It was not necessary to indicate that the tension forces had the same magnitudes or that the weights were different.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For a correct approach using Newton’s 2nd law and the static equilibrium condition for the 4 kg mass that leads to a relationship between tension and weight

T = mg

T = (4.0 kg)(9.8 m/s2)

1 point is earned: For the correct answer

T = 39 N (40 N using g = 10m/s2)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For a correct application of Newton’s 2nd law and the static equilibrium condition for the 8 kg mass leading to a relationship between tension from part (b) and spring force
T = Fs = k∆x
k = T / ∆x

1 point is earned: For using the correct displacement of the spring from equilibrium
∆x = 0.25m - 0.20m = 0.05m

1 point is earned: For a correct calculation leading to a positive value of k using the tension from (b)

k = 39 N/0.05 m

k = 780 N/m (800 N/m using 40 N from part (b) )

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For a correct kinematic approach for an accelerating system applied to the 4 kg mass

y= 1 2 g t 2 t= 2y/g t= 2( 0.70m )( 9.8m/ s 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWG5b Gaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGaaGOmaaaacaWGNbGaamiDamaa CaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpdaGcaaqaaiaaik dacaWG5bGaai4laiaadEgaaSqabaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0ZaaOaa aeaacaaIYaWaaeWaaeaacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaiEdacaaIWaGaamyBaa GaayjkaiaawMcaamaabmaabaGaaGyoaiaac6cacaaI4aGaamyBaiaa c+cacaWGZbWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaaGccaGLOaGaayzkaaaale qaaaaaaa@5166@

Note: An alternate approach using conservation of energy to determine the speed at the bottom and then use of a kinematic equation for time could also earn full credit.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For using conservation of energy, setting the spring potential energy equal to the kinetic energy of the block
